summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning, the Word existed. The Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He existed in the beginning with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through him all things were made, and apart from him nothing was made that has been made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him was life, and that life brought light to humanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the light shines on in the darkness, and the darkness has never put it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came as a witness to testify about the light, so that all might believe because of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was not the light, but he came to testify about the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the true light that enlightens every person by his coming into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was made through him. Yet the world did not recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to his own creation, yet his own people did not receive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, to all who received him, those believing in his name, he gave authority to become God’s children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were born, not merely in a genetic sense, nor from lust, nor from man’s desire, but from the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word became flesh and lived among us. We gazed on his glory, the kind of glory that belongs to the Father’s uniquely existing Son, who is full of grace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John told the truth about him when he cried out, “This is the person about whom I said, ‘The one who comes after me ranks higher than me, because he existed before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have all received one gracious gift after another from his abundance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because while the Law was given through Moses, grace and truth came through Jesus the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has ever seen God. The uniquely existing God, who is close to the Father’s side, has revealed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was John’s testimony when the Jewish leaders sent priests and descendants of Levi to him from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke openly and, remaining true to himself, admitted, “I am not the Messiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they asked him, “Well then, are you Elijah?”
John said, “I am not.”
“Are you the Prophet?”
He answered, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who are you?” they asked him. “We must give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He replied, “I am
‘…a voice crying out in the wilderness,
    “Prepare the Lord’s highway,”’
as the prophet Isaiah said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those men had been sent from the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Why, then, are you baptizing if you are not the Messiah, or Elijah, or the Prophet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, “I am baptizing with water, but among you stands a man whom you do not know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the one who is coming after me, whose sandal straps I am not worthy to untie.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened in Bethany on the other side of the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the one about whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who ranks above me, because he existed before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I didn’t recognize him, but I came baptizing with water so that he might be revealed to Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John also testified, “I saw the Spirit coming down from heaven like a dove, and it remained on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I didn’t recognize him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water told me, ‘The person on whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen this and have testified that this is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, John was standing there again with two of his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he watched Jesus walk by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the two disciples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But when Jesus turned around and saw them following, he asked them, “What are you looking for?”
They asked him, “Rabbi,” (which is translated “Teacher”), “where are you staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He told them, “Come and see!” So they went and saw where he was staying, and they remained with him that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of the two who heard John and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and say to him, “We have found the Anointed One!” (which is translated “Messiah”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him intently and said, “You are Simon, John’s son. You will be called Cephas!” (which is translated “Peter”).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The next day, Jesus decided to go away to Galilee, where he found Philip and told him, “Follow me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the hometown of Andrew and Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathaniel and told him, “We have found the man about whom Moses in the Law and the Prophets wrote—Jesus, the son of Joseph, from Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nathaniel asked him, “From Nazareth? Can anything good come from there?”
Philip told him, “Come and see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathaniel coming toward him and said about him, “Look, a genuine Israeli, in whom there is no deceit!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Nathaniel asked him, “How do you know me?”
Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, while you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathaniel replied to him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Do you believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than that.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he told him, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, you will see heaven standing open and the angels of God going up and coming down to the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On the third day of that week there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother told him, “They don’t have any more wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How does that concern us, dear lady?” Jesus asked her. “My time hasn’t come yet.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother told the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now standing there were six stone water jars used for the Jewish rites of purification, each one holding from two to three measures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told the servants, “Fill the jars with water.” So they filled them up to the brim.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he told them, “Now draw some out and take it to the man in charge of the banquet.” So they did.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the man in charge of the banquet tasted the water that had become wine (without knowing where it had come from, though the servants who had drawn the water knew), he called for the bridegroom
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told him, “Everyone serves the best wine first, and the cheap kind when people are drunk. But you have kept the best wine until now!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus did this, the first of his signs, in Cana of Galilee. He revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus went down to Capernaum—he, his mother, his brothers, and his disciples—and they remained there for a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish Passover was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Temple he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves, as well as moneychangers sitting at their tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After making a whip out of cords, he drove all of them out of the Temple, including the sheep and the cattle. He scattered the coins of the moneychangers and knocked over their tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told those who were selling the doves, “Take these things out of here! Stop making my Father’s house a marketplace!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will consume me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders asked him, “What sign can you show us as authority for doing these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this sanctuary, and in three days I will rebuild it.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Jewish leaders said, “This sanctuary has been under construction for 46 years, and you’re going to rebuild it in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the sanctuary he was speaking about was his own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had been raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this. So they believed the Scripture and the statement that Jesus had made.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While Jesus was in Jerusalem for the Passover Festival, many people believed in him because they saw the signs that he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, however, did not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and didn’t need anyone to tell him what people were like, because he himself knew what was in every person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man from the Pharisees, a leader of the Jews, whose name was Nicodemus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Jesus at night and told him, “Rabbi, we know that you have come from God as a teacher, because no one can perform these signs that you are doing unless God is with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to him, “Truly, I tell you emphatically, unless a person is born from above he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus asked him, “How can a person be born when he is old? He can’t go back into his mother’s womb a second time and be born, can he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Truly, I tell you emphatically, unless a person is born of water and Spirit he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What is born of the flesh is flesh, and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be astonished that I told you, ‘All of you must be born from above.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows where it wants to. You hear its sound, but you don’t know where it comes from or where it is going. That’s the way it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus asked him, “How can that be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “You’re the teacher of Israel, and you can’t understand this?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly, I tell you emphatically, we know what we’re talking about, and we testify about what we’ve seen. Yet you people do not accept our testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If I have told you people about earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one has gone up to heaven except the one who came down from heaven, the Son of Man who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that everyone who believes in him would have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For this is how God loved the world: He gave his uniquely existing Son so that everyone who believes in him would not be lost but have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Because God sent the Son into the world, not to condemn the world, but that the world would be saved through him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe has already been condemned, because he has not believed in the name of God’s uniquely existing Son.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And this is the basis for judgment: The light has come into the world, but people loved the darkness more than the light because their actions were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone who practices wickedness hates the light and does not come to the light, so that his actions may not be exposed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whoever does what is true comes to the light, so that it may become evident that his actions have God’s approval.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After this, Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside. He spent some time there with them and began baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was also baptizing in Aenon, near Salim, because there was plenty of water there. People kept coming and were being baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since John had not yet been thrown into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a controversy about ritual purification sprang up between a certain Jew and John’s disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so they went to John and told him, “Rabbi, the man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, the one about whom you testified—look, he’s baptizing, and everyone is going to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John replied, “No one can receive anything unless it has been given to them from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You yourselves are my witnesses that I said, ‘I am not the Messiah, but I have been sent ahead of him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is the bridegroom who gets the bride, yet the bridegroom’s friend, who merely stands by and listens for him, is overjoyed to hear the bridegroom’s voice. That’s why this joy of mine is now complete.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must become more important, but I must become less important.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who comes from above is superior to everything. The one who is of the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things. The one who comes from heaven is superior to everything.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He testifies about what he has seen and heard, yet no one accepts his testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The person who has accepted his testimony has acknowledged that God is truthful.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one whom God sent speaks the words of God, because God does not give the Spirit in limited measure to him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves the Son and has put everything in his hands.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life, but the one who disobeys the Son will not see life. Instead, the wrath of God remains on him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when Jesus realized that the Pharisees had heard he was making and baptizing more disciples than John—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: although it was not Jesus who did the baptizing but his disciples—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he left Judea and went back to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was necessary for him to go through Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he came to a town in Samaria called Sychar, near the piece of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob’s Well was also there, and Jesus, tired out by the journey, sat down by the well. It was about noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Samaritan woman came to draw water, and Jesus told her, “Please give me a drink,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since his disciples had gone off into town to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Samaritan woman asked him, “How can you, a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” Because Jews do not have anything to do with Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who is saying to you, ‘Please give me a drink,’ you would have been the one to ask him, and he would have given you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman told him, “Sir, you don’t have a bucket, and the well is deep. Where are you going to get this living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’re not greater than our ancestor Jacob, who gave us the well and drank from it, along with his sons and his flocks, are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “Everyone who drinks this water will become thirsty again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever drinks the water that I will give him will never become thirsty again. The water that I will give him will become a well of water for him, springing up to eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman told him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I won’t get thirsty or have to keep coming here to draw water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told her, “Go and call your husband, and come back here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman answered him, “I don’t have a husband.”
Jesus told her, “You are quite right in saying, ‘I don’t have a husband,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you have had five husbands, and the man you have now is not your husband. What you have said is true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman told him, “Sir, I see that you are a prophet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our ancestors worshipped on this mountain. But you Jews say that the place where people should worship is in Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “Believe me, dear lady, the hour is coming when you Samaritans will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You don’t know what you’re worshiping. We Jews know what we’re worshiping, because salvation comes from the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the time is coming, and is now here, when true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth. Indeed, the Father is looking for people like that to worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman told him, “I know that the Anointed One is coming, who is being called ‘the Messiah’. When that person comes, he will explain everything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I AM,” Jesus replied, “the one who is speaking to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point his disciples arrived, and they were astonished that he was talking to a woman. Yet no one said, “What do you want from her?” or, “Why are you talking to her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman left her water jar and went back to town. She told people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything I’ve ever done! Could he possibly be the Messiah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people left the town and started on their way to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the disciples were urging him, “Rabbi, have something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples began to say to one another, “No one has brought him anything to eat, have they?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “My food is doing the will of the one who sent me and completing his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say, don’t you, ‘In four more months the harvest will begin?’ Look, I tell you, open your eyes and observe that the fields are ready for harvesting now!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who harvests is already receiving his wages and gathering a crop for eternal life, so that the one who sows and the one who harvests may rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this respect the saying is true: ‘One person sows, and another person harvests.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent you to harvest what you have not worked for. Others have worked, and you have adopted their work as your own.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now many of the Samaritans of that town believed in Jesus because the woman had testified, “He told me everything I’ve ever done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Samaritans came to Jesus, they asked him to stay with them, and he stayed there for two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many more believed because of what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept telling the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, because now we have heard him ourselves, and we know that he really is the Savior of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two days later, Jesus left for Galilee from there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him because they had seen everything that he had done in Jerusalem during the festival and because they, too, had gone to the festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus returned to Cana in Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. Meanwhile, in Capernaum there was a government official whose son was ill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and asked him repeatedly to come down and heal his son, because he was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will never believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official told him, “Sir, please come down before my little boy dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Go home. Your son will live.” The man believed what Jesus told him and started back home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was on his way, his servants met him and told him that his child was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he asked them at what hour he had begun to recover, and they told him, “The fever left him yesterday at one o’clock in the afternoon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father realized that this was the very hour when Jesus had told him, “Your son will live.” So he himself believed, along with his whole family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this was the second sign that Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, there was another festival of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Near the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem is a pool called Bethesda in Hebrew. It has five colonnades,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and under these a large number of sick people were lying—blind, lame, or paralyzed—waiting for the movement of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At certain times an angel of the Lord would go down into the pool and stir up the water, and whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was healed of whatever disease he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One particular man was there who had been ill for 38 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw him lying there and knew that he had already been there a long time, he asked him, “Do you want to get well?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sick man answered him, “Sir, I don’t have anyone to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up. While I’m trying to get there, someone else steps down ahead of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Stand up, pick up your mat, and walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man immediately became well, and he picked up his mat and started walking. Now that day was a Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders told the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not lawful for you to carry your mat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “The man who made me well told me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Who is the man who told you, ‘Pick it up and walk’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who had been healed did not know who it was, because Jesus had slipped away from the crowd in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, Jesus found him in the Temple and told him, “Look! You have become well. Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man went off and told the Jewish leaders that it was Jesus who had made him well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders began persecuting Jesus, because he kept doing such things on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, “My Father has been working until now, and I, too, am working.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders were trying all the harder to kill him, because he was not only breaking the Sabbath but was also calling God his own Father, thereby making himself equal to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, the Son can do nothing on his own accord, but only what he sees the Father doing, What the Father does, the Son does likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father loves the Son and shows him everything he is doing, and he will show him even greater actions than these, so that you may be amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to those he chooses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father judges no one, but has given all authority to judge to the Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that everyone may honor the Son as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, whoever hears what I say and believes in the one who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged, but has passed from death to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, the time approaches, and is now here, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear it will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the Father has life in himself, so also he has granted the Son to have life in himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has given him authority to judge, because he is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be amazed at this, because the time is approaching when everyone in their graves will hear the Son of Man’s voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will come out—those who have done what is good to the resurrection that leads to life, and those who have practiced what is evil to the resurrection that ends in condemnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can do nothing on my own accord. I judge according to what I hear, and my judgment is just, because I do not seek my own will but the will of the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I testify on my own behalf, my testimony is not trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is another who testifies about me, and I know that the testimony he gives about me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sent messengers to John, and he has testified to the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself do not accept human testimony, but I am saying these things so that you may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That man John was a lamp that burns and brightly shines, and for a while you were willing to rejoice in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I have a greater testimony than John’s, because the actions that the Father has given me to complete—the very actions that I am doing—testify on my behalf that the Father has sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Father who sent me has himself testified on my behalf. You have never heard his voice or seen what he looks like,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor do you have his word at work in you, because you do not believe in the one whom he sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You examine the Scriptures carefully because you suppose that in them you have eternal life. Yet they testify about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not willing to come to me to have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not accept human praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that you do not have the love of God in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you do not accept me. Yet if another man comes in his own name, you will accept him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you believe when you accept each other’s praise and do not look for the praise that comes from the only God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not suppose that I will be the one to accuse you before the Father. Your accuser is Moses, on whom you have set your hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because if you believed Moses, you would believe me, since he wrote about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not believe what he wrote, how will you believe my words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (that is, to Tiberias).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd kept following him because they had seen the signs that he was performing by healing the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus went up on a hillside and sat down there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover, the festival of the Jews, was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus looked up and saw that a large crowd was coming toward him, he asked Philip, “Where can we buy bread for these people to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said this to test him, because he himself knew what he was going to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip answered him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread isn’t enough for each of them to have a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of his disciples, Andrew, who was Simon Peter’s brother, told him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There’s a little boy here who has five barley loaves and two small fish. But what are these among so many people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” Now there was plenty of grass in that area, so they sat down, numbering about 5,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed them to those who were seated. He also distributed as much fish as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were completely satisfied, Jesus told his disciples, “Collect the pieces that are left over so that nothing is wasted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they collected and filled twelve baskets full of pieces of the five barley loaves left over by those who had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people saw the sign that he had done, they kept saying, “Truly this is the Prophet who was to come into the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, realizing that they were about to come and take him by force to make him king, withdrew again to the hillside by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: got into a boat, and started across the sea to Capernaum. Darkness had already fallen, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A strong wind was blowing, and the sea was getting rough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had rowed about 25 or 30 stadia, they saw Jesus walking on the sea toward their boat. They became terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “It is I. Stop being afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were glad to take him on board, and immediately the boat reached the land toward which they were going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, the crowd that had remained on the other side of the sea noticed that only one boat had been there, and no other, and that Jesus had not gotten into that boat with his disciples. Instead, his disciples had gone away by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other small boats from Tiberias arrived near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into these boats and went to Capernaum to look for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, you are looking for me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate the loaves and were completely satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not work for food that perishes but for food that lasts for eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you, because God the Father has set his seal on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “What must we do to perform God’s works?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “This is God’s work: to believe in the one whom he has sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “What sign are you going to do so that we may see it and believe in you? What actions are you performing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, it was not Moses who gave you the bread from heaven, but it is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told him, “Sir, give us this bread all the time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never become hungry, and whoever believes in me will never become thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I told you that you have seen me, yet you don’t believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything the Father gives me will come to me, and I’ll never turn away the one who comes to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the will of the one who sent me, that I should not lose anything that he has given me, but should raise it to life on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my Father’s will: That everyone who sees the Son and believes in him should have eternal life, and I will raise him to life on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders began grumbling about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept saying, “This is Jesus, the son of Joseph, isn’t it, whose father and mother we know? So how can he say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Stop grumbling among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him to life on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the Prophets, ‘And all of them will be taught by God.’ Everyone who has listened to the Father and has learned anything comes to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who comes from God. This one has seen the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, the one who believes in me has eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m the bread of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread that comes down from heaven, so that a person may eat it and not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats this bread, he’ll live forever. And the bread I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders debated angrily with each other, asking, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told them, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you don’t have life in yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I’ll raise him to life on the last day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because my flesh is real food, and my blood is real drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so the one who feeds on me will also live because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not the kind that your ancestors ate. They died, but the one who eats this bread will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this while teaching in the synagogue at Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When many of his disciples heard this, they said, “This is a difficult statement. Who can accept it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, knowing within himself that his disciples were grumbling about this, asked them, “Does this offend you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What if you saw the Son of Man going up to the place where he was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s the Spirit who gives life; the flesh accomplishes nothing. The words that I’ve spoken to you are spirit and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some among you who don’t believe...”—because Jesus knew from the beginning those who weren’t believing, as well as the one who would betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “That’s why I told you that no one can come to me unless it be granted him by the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, many of his disciples turned back and no longer associated with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus asked the Twelve, “You don’t want to leave, too, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, we have believed and remain convinced that you are the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I chose you, the Twelve, didn’t I? Yet one of you is a devil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was speaking about Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, because this man was going to betray him, even though he was one of the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus traveled throughout Galilee, because he didn’t want to travel in Judea, since the Jewish leaders there were trying to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jewish Festival of Tents was approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his brothers told him, “You should leave this place and go to Judea, so that your disciples can see the actions that you’re doing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since no one acts in secret if he wants to be known publicly. If you’re going to do these things, you should reveal yourself to the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not even his brothers believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me because I testify against it that its actions are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to the festival yourselves. I am not going to this festival yet, because my time hasn’t fully come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, he remained in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after his brothers had gone up to the festival, he went up himself, not openly but, as it were, in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders kept looking for him at the festival, asking, “Where is that man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a great deal of discussion about him among the crowds. Some were saying, “He is a good man,” while others were saying, “No, he is deceiving the crowds!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, no one would speak openly about him because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Halfway through the festival, Jesus went up to the Temple and began teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders were astonished and remarked, “How can this man be so educated when he has never gone to school?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “My teaching is not mine but comes from the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to do his will, he’ll know whether this teaching is from God or whether I’m speaking on my own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who speaks on his own seeks his own praise. But the one who seeks the praise of him who sent him is genuine, and there’s nothing false in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave you the Law, didn’t he? Yet none of you is keeping the Law. Why are you trying to kill me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd answered, “You have a demon! Who is trying to kill you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I performed one action, and all of you are astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave you circumcision—not that it is from Moses, but from the Patriarchs—and so you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath so that the Law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me because I made a man perfectly well on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stop judging by appearances, but judge with righteous judgment!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the people of Jerusalem began saying, “This is the man they are trying to kill, isn’t it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And look, he is speaking in public, and they are not saying anything to him! Can it be that the authorities really know that this is the Messiah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know where this man comes from. But when the Messiah comes, no one will know where he comes from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point Jesus, still teaching in the Temple, shouted, “So you know me and know where I’ve come from? I haven’t come on my own accord. But the one who sent me is true, and he’s the one you don’t know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know him because I’ve come from him, and he sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, the Jewish leaders kept trying to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him because his hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, many in the crowd believed in him. They kept saying, “When the Messiah comes, he won’t do more signs than this man has done, will he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees heard the crowd debating these things about him, so the high priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “I’ll be with you only a little while longer, and then I’m going back to the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ll look for me but won’t find me. And where I am, you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders asked one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we won’t be able to find him? Surely he’s not going to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What does this statement mean that he said, ‘You’ll look for me but won’t find me,’ and, ‘Where I am, you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the last and most important day of the festival, Jesus stood up and shouted, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who believes in me, as the Scripture has said, will have rivers of living water flowing from his heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he said this about the Spirit, whom those who were believing in him were to receive, because the Spirit was not yet present and Jesus had not yet been glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these words, some in the crowd were saying, “This really is the Prophet,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
while others were saying, “This is the Messiah!”
But some were saying, “The Messiah doesn’t come from Galilee, does he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doesn’t the Scripture say that the Messiah is from David’s family and from Bethlehem, the village where David lived?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was a division in the crowd because of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were wanting to seize him, but no one laid hands on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers returned to the high priests and Pharisees, who asked them, “Why didn’t you bring him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like that!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees replied to them, “You haven’t been deceived, too, have you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the authorities or Pharisees has believed in him, have they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this mob that does not know the Law—they’re under a curse!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of their own, Nicodemus (the man who had previously met with Jesus), asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely our Law does not condemn a person without first hearing from him and finding out what he is doing, does it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “You aren’t from Galilee, too, are you? Search and see that no prophet comes from Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all of them went to their own homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, however, went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At daybreak he appeared again in the Temple, and all the people came to him. So he sat down and began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery. After setting her before them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they told him, “Teacher, this woman has been caught in the very act of adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the Law, Moses commanded us to stone such women to death. What do you say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said this to test him, so that they might have a charge against him. But Jesus bent down and began to write on the ground with his finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they persisted in questioning him, he straightened up and told them, “Let the person among you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he bent down again and continued writing on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they went away one by one, beginning with the oldest, and he was left alone with the woman standing there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus stood up and asked her, “Dear lady, where are your accusers? Hasn’t anyone condemned you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“No one, sir,” she replied.
Then Jesus said, “I don’t condemn you, either. Go home, and from now on don’t sin anymore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, Jesus spoke to them again, saying, “I am the light of the world. The one who follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees told him, “You’re testifying about yourself. Your testimony isn’t valid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Even though I’m testifying about myself, my testimony is valid because I know where I’ve come from and where I’m going. But you don’t know where I come from or where I’m going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’re judging by human standards, but I’m not judging anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even if I should judge, my judgment would be valid, because it is not I alone who judges, but I and the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your own Law it is written that the testimony of two people is valid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m testifying about myself, and the Father who sent me is testifying about me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they asked him, “Where is this Father of yours?”
Jesus replied, “You don’t know me or my Father. If you had known me, you would’ve known my Father, too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke these words in the treasury, while he was teaching in the Temple. Yet no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, he told them again, “I’m going away, and you’ll look for me, but you will die in your sin. You cannot come where I’m going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders were asking, “He isn’t going to kill himself, is he? Is that why he said, ‘You cannot come where I’m going’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “You are from below, I’m from above. You are of this world, but I’m not of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I told you that you will die in your sins, for unless you believe that I AM, you’ll die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they asked him, “Who are you?”
Jesus told them, “What have I been telling you all along?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have much to say about you and to condemn you for. But the one who sent me is truthful, and what I’ve heard from him I declare to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t realize that he was talking to them about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I AM, and that I do nothing on my own authority. Instead, I speak only what the Father has taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the one who sent me is with me. He has never left me alone, because I always do what pleases him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was saying these things, many believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told those Jews who had believed in him, “If you continue in my word, you are really my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied to him, “We are Abraham’s descendants and have never been slaves to anybody. So how can you say, ‘You will be set free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, that everyone who commits sin is a slave of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slave does not remain in the household forever, but the son does remain forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I know that you are Abraham’s descendants. Yet you are trying to kill me because you’ve not received what I’ve told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I declare what I’ve seen in my Father’s presence, and you’re doing what you’ve heard from your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They replied to him, “Our father is Abraham!”
Jesus told them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would be doing what Abraham did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you’re trying to kill me, a man who has told you the truth that I heard from God. Abraham wouldn’t have done that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are doing your father’s actions.”
They told him, “We’re not illegitimate children. We have one Father, God himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “If God were your Father, you would’ve loved me, because I came from God and am here. I haven’t come on my own accord, but he sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why don’t you understand what I’ve said? It’s because you can’t listen to my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You belong to your father the Devil, and you want to carry out the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning and has never stood for truth, since there is no truth in him. Whenever he tells a lie, he speaks in character, because he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is because I speak the truth that you don’t believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can any of you prove me guilty of sin? If I’m telling the truth, why don’t you believe me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who belongs to God listens to the words of God. The reason you don’t listen is because you don’t belong to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders replied to him, “Surely we’re right in saying that you are a Samaritan and have a demon, aren’t we?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I don’t have a demon. On the contrary, I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t seek my own glory. There is one who seeks it, and he is the Judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, if anyone keeps my word, he will never see death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders told him, “Now we really know that you have a demon. Abraham died, and so did the prophets, but you say, ‘If anyone keeps my word, he will never taste death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You aren’t greater than our father Abraham, who died, are you? The prophets also died. Who are you making yourself out to be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “If I were trying to glorify myself, my glory would mean nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say, ‘He is our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You don’t know him, but I know him. If I were to say that I don’t know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him and keep his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced that he would see my day, and he saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders asked him, “You are not even 50 years old, yet you have seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, before there was an Abraham, I AM!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this, they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus hid himself and went out of the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was walking along, he observed a man who had been blind from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that caused him to be born blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned. This happened so that God’s work might be revealed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I must do the work of the one who sent me while it is day. Night is approaching, when no one can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as I’m in the world, I’m the light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, he spit on the ground and made mud with the saliva. Then he spread the mud on the man’s eyes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told him, “Go and wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated “Sent One”). So he went off, washed, and came back seeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the neighbors and those who had previously seen him as a beggar said, “This is the man who used to sit and beg, isn’t it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some were saying, “It’s him,” while others were saying, “No, but it’s someone like him.”
But he himself kept saying, “It’s me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “How, then, did you gain your eyesight?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The man named Jesus made some mud, spread it on my eyes, and told me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash.’ So off I went and washed, and I received my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked him, “Where is that man?”
He said, “I don’t know!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought to the Pharisees the man who had once been blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the mud and healed his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees also began to ask him how he had gained his sight. He told them, “He put mud on my eyes, then I washed, and now I can see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some of the Pharisees began to remark, “This man is not from God because he does not keep the Sabbath.”
But others were saying, “How can a sinful man perform such signs?” And there was a division among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they asked the formerly blind man again, “What do you say about him, since it was your eyes he healed?”
He said, “He is a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders did not believe that the man had been blind and had gained sight until they summoned his parents
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked them, “Is this your son, the one you say was born blind? How does he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents replied, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we don’t know how it is that he now sees, and we don’t know who opened his eyes. Ask him. He is of age and can speak for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders, since the Jewish leaders had already agreed that anyone who acknowledged that Jesus was the Messiah would be thrown out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders summoned the man who had been blind a second time and told him, “Give glory to God! We know that this man is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he responded, “I don’t know whether he is a sinner or not. The one thing I do know is that I used to be blind and now I can see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “What did he do to you? How did he heal your eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I’ve already told you, but you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don’t want to become his disciples, too, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this, they turned on him in fury and said, “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses, but we do not know where this fellow comes from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man answered them, “This is an amazing thing! You don’t know where he comes from, yet he healed my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but he does listen to anyone who worships him and does his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ever since creation it has never been heard that anyone healed the eyes of a man who was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this man were not from God, he couldn’t do anything like that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “You were born a sinner and you are trying to instruct us?” And they threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out. So when he found him, he asked him, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “And who is he, sir? Tell me, so that I may believe in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “You have seen him. He is the person who is talking with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Lord, I do believe,” and worshipped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “I have come into this world to judge it, so that those who are blind may see and so that those who see may become blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees who were near him overheard this and asked him, “We aren’t blind, too, are we?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “If you were blind, you would not have any sin. But now that you insist, ‘We see,’ your sin still exists.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, the person who doesn’t enter the sheepfold through the gate, but climbs in by some other way, is a thief and a bandit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who enters through the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s to him the gatekeeper opens the gate, and it’s his voice the sheep hear. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has driven out all his own, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they recognize his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll never follow a stranger, but will run away from him because they don’t recognize the voice of strangers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used this illustration with them, but they didn’t understand what he was saying to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So again Jesus said, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, I’m the gate for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who came before me are thieves and bandits, but the sheep didn’t listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m the gate. If anyone enters through me, he will be saved. He’ll come in and go out and find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief comes only to steal, slaughter, and destroy. I’ve come that they may have life, and have it abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hired worker, who isn’t the shepherd and doesn’t own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, deserts the sheep, and runs away. So the wolf snatches them and scatters them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he’s a hired worker, and the sheep don’t matter to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m the good shepherd. I know my own and my own know me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father. And I lay down my life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have other sheep that don’t belong to this fold. I must lead these also, and they’ll listen to my voice. So there will be one flock and one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why the Father loves me, because I lay down my life in order to take it back again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is taking it from me; I lay it down of my own free will. I have the authority to lay it down, and I have the authority to take it back again. This is what my Father has commanded me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again there was a division among the Jews because of what Jesus had been saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of them were saying, “He has a demon and is insane. Why bother listening to him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were saying, “These are not the words of a man who is demon-possessed. A demon cannot open the eyes of the blind, can it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hanukkah was taking place in Jerusalem. It was winter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus was walking around in the Temple inside the open porch of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders surrounded him and quizzed him, “How long are you going to keep us in suspense? If you’re the Messiah, tell us so plainly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I have told you, but you don’t believe it. The actions that I do in my Father’s name testify on my behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you don’t believe, because you don’t belong to my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep hear my voice. I know them, and they follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give them eternal life, they’ll never be lost, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What my Father has given me is more important than anything, and no one can snatch it from the Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I and the Father are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Jewish leaders picked up stones to stone him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “I’ve shown you many good actions from my Father. For which of them are you going to stone me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders answered him, “We are not going to stone you for a good action, but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, are making yourself God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “Is it not written in your Law, ‘I said, “You are gods”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he called those to whom a message from God came ‘gods’ (and the Scripture cannot be disregarded),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how can you say to the one whom the Father has consecrated and sent into the world, ‘You’re blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I’m the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I’m not doing my Father’s actions, don’t believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I’m doing them, even though you don’t believe me, believe the actions, so that you may know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again they tried to seize him, but he slipped away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went away again across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing at first, and he remained there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people came to him and kept saying, “John never performed a sign, but everything that John said about this man is true!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many believed in Jesus there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man was ill, Lazarus from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary was the woman who anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair. Her brother Lazarus was the one who was ill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sisters sent word to Jesus and told him, “Lord, the one whom you love is ill.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard it, he said, “This illness isn’t meant to end in death. It’s for God’s glory, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet, when he heard that Lazarus was ill, he stayed where he was for two more days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, he told the disciples, “Let’s go back to Judea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples told him, “Rabbi, the Jewish leaders were just now trying to stone you to death, and you are going back there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “There are twelve hours in the day, aren’t there? If anyone walks during the day he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone walks at night he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the things he said.
Then after this, he told them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I’m leaving to wake him up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples told him, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, however, had been speaking about his death, but they thought that he was speaking about resting or sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus has died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your sake I’m glad that I wasn’t there, so that you may believe. But let’s go to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Thomas, who was called the Twin, told his fellow disciples, “Let’s go, too, so that we may die with him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary to console them about their brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met him, while Mary stayed at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha told Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even now I know that whatever you ask of God, he will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha told him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The person who believes in me, even though he dies, will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, everyone who lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe that?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, Lord,” she told him. “I believe that you are the Messiah, the Son of God, the one who was to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had said this, she went away and called her sister Mary and told her privately, “The Teacher is here and is calling for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus had not yet arrived at the village but was still at the place where Martha had met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Jews who had been with her, consoling her in the house, saw Mary get up quickly and go out, they followed her, thinking that she had gone to the tomb to cry there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Mary came to where Jesus was and saw him, she fell down at his feet and told him, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her crying, and the Jews who had come with her crying, he was greatly troubled in spirit and deeply moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked, “Where have you put him?”
They told him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus burst into tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews said, “See how much he loved him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “Surely the one who opened the eyes of the blind man could have kept this man from dying, couldn’t he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Groaning deeply again, Jesus came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying in front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Remove the stone.”
Martha, the dead man’s sister, told him, “Lord, there must be a stench by now, because he’s been dead for four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “I told you that if you believed you would see God’s glory, didn’t I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they removed the stone.
Then Jesus looked upward and said, “Father, I thank you for hearing me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that you always hear me, but I have said this for the sake of the crowd standing here, so that they may believe that you sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, he shouted with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who had died came out, his hands and feet tied with strips of cloth, and his face wrapped in a handkerchief. Jesus told them, “Untie him, and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the Jews who had come with Mary and who had observed what Jesus did believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them, however, went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the high priests and the Pharisees assembled the Council and said, “What are we going to do? This man is performing many signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and destroy both our Temple and our nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, told them, “You don’t know anything!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You don’t realize that it is better for you to have one man die for the people than to have the whole nation destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he did not say this on his own initiative. As high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only for the nation, but that he would also gather into one the children of God who were scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that day on they resolved to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews. Instead, he went from there to a town called Ephraim in the region near the wilderness. There he remained with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jewish Passover was approaching, and before the Passover many people from the countryside went up to Jerusalem to purify themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept looking for Jesus and saying to one another as they stood in the Temple, “What do you think? Surely he won’t come to the festival, will he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the high priests and the Pharisees had given orders that whoever knew where he was should tell them so that they could arrest him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days before the Passover, Jesus arrived in Bethany, where Lazarus lived, the man whom Jesus had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they gave a dinner for him. Martha served, and Lazarus was one of those at the table with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary took a litron of very expensive perfume made of pure nard and anointed Jesus’ feet. She wiped his feet with her hair, and the house became filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, who was going to betray him, asked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why wasn’t this perfume sold for 300 denarii and the money given to the destitute?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this, not because he cared about the destitute, but because he was a thief. He was in charge of the moneybag and would steal what was put into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Leave her alone so she can observe the day of my burial,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you will always have the destitute with you, but you won’t always have me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the large crowd of Jews realized that he was there, they came not only because of Jesus but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the high priests planned to kill Lazarus, too,
verses.speaker: Narrator
