verses.text: since he was the reason why so many of the Jews were leaving to believe in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, the large crowd that had come to the festival heard that Jesus was coming into Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet him, shouting,
“Hosanna!
How blessed is the one who comes
    in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus found a young donkey and sat upon it, as it is written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stop being afraid, people of Zion.
Look, your king is coming,
    sitting upon a donkey’s colt!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At first, his disciples didn’t understand these things. However, when Jesus had been glorified, they remembered that these things had been written about him and that people had done these things to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the crowd that had been with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to testify to what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd was going out to meet Jesus because they had heard that he had performed this sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees told one another, “You see, there is nothing you can do. Look, the world has gone after him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some Greeks were among those who had come up to worship at the festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Philip (who was from Bethsaida in Galilee) and told him, “Sir, we would like to see Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went and told Andrew, and Andrew and Philip went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, unless a grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone. But if it dies, it produces a lot of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who loves his life will destroy it, and the one who hates his life in this world will preserve it for eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone serves me, he must follow me. And where I am, there my servant will also be. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now my soul is in turmoil, and what should I say—‘Father, save me from this hour’? No! It was for this very reason that I came to this hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father, glorify your name.”
Then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crowd standing there heard this and said that it was thunder.
Others were saying, “An angel has spoken to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “This voice is for your benefit, not for mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now is the time for the judgment of this world to begin. Now the ruler of this world will be thrown out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, if I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw all people to myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to indicate the kind of death he was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the crowd answered him, “We have learned from the Law that the Messiah remains forever. So how can you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to the crowd, “The light is among you only for a short time. Walk while you have the light, so that the darkness may not overtake you. The person who walks in the darkness is in the darkness and does not know where he is going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become children of light.” After Jesus had said this, he went away and hid from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although he had performed numerous signs in their presence, they did not believe in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that what the prophet Isaiah spoke might be fulfilled when he said:
“Lord, who has believed our message,
    and to whom has the Lord’s power been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why they could not believe: Isaiah also said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has blinded their eyes
    and hardened their heart,
so that they might not perceive with their eyes,
    and understand with their mind and turn,
        and I would heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said this when he saw his glory and spoke about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet many people, even some of the authorities, believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they did not admit it so they would not be thrown out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they loved the praise of human beings more than the praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said loudly, “The one who believes in me does not believe in me only, but also in the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who sees me sees the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve come into the world as light, so that everyone who believes in me won’t remain in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone hears my words and doesn’t keep them, I don’t condemn him, because I didn’t come to condemn the world, but to save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who rejects me and doesn’t receive my words has something to judge him: The word that I’ve spoken will judge him on the last day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I haven’t spoken on my own authority. Instead, the Father who sent me has himself commanded me what to say and how to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that what he commands brings eternal life. What I speak, therefore, I speak just as the Father has told me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before the Passover Festival, Jesus realized that his hour had come to leave this world and return to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By supper time, the Devil had already put it into the heart of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, to betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Jesus knew that the Father had given everything into his control, that he had come from God, and that he was returning to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore he got up from the table, removed his outer robe, and took a towel and fastened it around his waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he poured some water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to dry them with the towel that was tied around his waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to Simon Peter, who asked him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “You don’t realize now what I’m doing, but later on you’ll understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter told him, “You must never wash my feet!”
Jesus answered him, “Unless I wash you, you cannot be involved with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter told him, “Lord, not just my feet, but my hands and my head as well!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Whoever has bathed is entirely clean. He doesn’t need to wash himself further, except for his feet. And you men are clean, though not all of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew who was going to betray him. That’s why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had washed their feet and put on his outer robe, he sat down again and told them, “Do you realize what I’ve done to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call me Teacher and Lord, and you are right because that is what I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you must also wash one another’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve set an example for you, so that you may do as I have done to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, a servant isn’t greater than his master, and a messenger isn’t greater than the one who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you understand these things, how blessed you are if you put them into practice!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m not talking about all of you. I know the ones I have chosen. But the Scripture must be fulfilled: ‘The one who ate bread with me has turned against me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m telling you this now, before it happens, so that when it does happen, you may believe that I AM.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, the one who receives whomever I send receives me, and the one who receives me receives the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, Jesus was deeply troubled in spirit and declared solemnly, “Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, one of you is going to betray me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples began looking at one another, completely mystified about whom he was speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of his disciples, the one whom Jesus kept loving, had been sitting very close to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter motioned to this man to ask Jesus about whom he was speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaning forward on Jesus’ chest, he asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered, “He is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread after I have dipped it in the dish.”
Then he took a piece of bread, dipped it, and gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had taken the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus told him, “Do quickly what you are going to do!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now no one at the table knew why Jesus said this to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some thought that, since Judas had the moneybag, Jesus was telling him to buy what they needed for the festival or to give something to the destitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas took the piece of bread, immediately went outside…and it was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Judas had gone out, Jesus said, “The Son of Man is now glorified, and God has been glorified by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God has been glorified by him, God himself also will glorify the Son of Man, and he will do so quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, I’m with you only a little longer. You will look for me, but what I told the Jewish leaders I now tell you, ‘Where I’m going, you cannot come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m giving you a new commandment…to love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also should love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter asked him, “Lord, where are you going?”
Jesus answered him, “I’m going where you cannot follow me now, though you will follow me later on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, why can’t I follow you now?” Peter asked him. “I would lay down my life for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Would you lay down your life for me? I tell you emphatically, a rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t let your hearts be troubled. Believe in God, believe also in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many rooms in my Father’s house. If there weren’t, I wouldn’t have told you that I am going away to prepare a place for you, would I?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since I’m going away to prepare a place for you, I’ll come back again and welcome you into my presence, so that you may be where I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know where I am going, and you know the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas asked him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going, so how can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have known me, you will also know my Father. From now on you know him and have seen him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip told him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that will satisfy us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have I been with you all this time, Philip, and you still do not know me?” Jesus asked him. “The person who has seen me has seen the Father. So how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You believe, don’t you, that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I don’t speak on my own. It is the Father who dwells in me and who carries out his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe me, I am in the Father and the Father is in me. Otherwise, believe me because of what I’ve been doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, the one who believes in me will also do what I’m doing. He will do even greater things than these, because I’m going to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask me for anything in my name, I will do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love me, keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will ask the Father to give you another Helper, to be with you always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees him nor recognizes him. But you recognize him, because he lives with you and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m not going to forsake you like orphans. I will come back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In a little while the world will no longer see me, but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, you’ll know that I am in my Father, that you are in me, and that I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who has my commandments and keeps them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I, too, will love him and reveal myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) asked him, “Lord, how is it that you are going to reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If anyone loves me, he will keep my word. Then my Father will love him, and we will go to him and make our home within him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who doesn’t love me doesn’t keep my words. The words that you’re hearing me say are not mine, but come from the Father who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you this while I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and remind you of everything that I have told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m leaving you at peace. I’m giving you my own peace. I’m not giving it to you as the world gives. So don’t let your hearts be troubled, and don’t be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard me tell you, ‘I’m going away, but I’m coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would rejoice that I’m going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve told you this now, before I leave, so that when I do leave, you will believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I won’t talk with you much longer, because the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I’m doing what the Father has commanded me, to let the world know that I love the Father. Get up! Let us leave this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the vintner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cuts off every branch that does not produce fruit in me, and he cuts back every branch that does produce fruit, so that it might produce more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are already clean because of what I’ve spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abide in me, and I will abide in you. Just as the branch cannot produce fruit by itself unless it abides in the vine, neither can you unless you abide in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the vine, you are the branches. The one who abides in me while I abide in him produces much fruit, because apart from me you can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unless a person abides in me, he is thrown away like a pruned branch and dries up. People gather such branches, throw them into a fire, and they are burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you abide in me and my words abide in you, you can ask for anything you want, and you’ll receive it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how my Father is glorified, when you produce a lot of fruit and so prove to be my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the Father has loved me, so I have loved you. So abide in my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you keep my commandments, you’ll abide in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve told you this, so that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is my commandment: that you love one another as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shows greater love than when he lays down his life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are my friends, if you do what I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t call you servants anymore, because a servant doesn’t know what his master is doing. But I’ve called you friends, because I’ve made known to you everything that I’ve heard from my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you. I have appointed you to go and produce fruit that will last, so that whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am giving you these commandments so that you may love one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hates you, you should realize that it hated me before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as one of its own. But because you do not belong to the world and I have chosen you out of it, the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what I told you: ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will also keep yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they do not know the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have any sin. But now they have no excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who hates me also hates my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I hadn’t done among them the actions that no one else did, they wouldn’t have any sin. But now they have seen and hated both me and my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this happened so that what has been written in their Law might be fulfilled: ‘They hated me for no reason.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Helper comes, whom I will send to you from the Father— the Spirit of Truth, who comes from the Father—he will testify on my behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will testify also, because you have been with me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you this to keep you from falling away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ll be thrown out of the synagogues. Yes, a time is coming when the one who kills you will think he’s serving God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll do this because they haven’t known the Father or me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I’ve told you this, so that when the time comes you’ll remember that I told you about them. I didn’t tell you this in the beginning, because I was still with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now I am going to the one who sent me. Yet none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I have told you this, sorrow has filled your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, I’m telling you the truth. It’s for your advantage that I’m going away, because if I don’t go away, the Helper won’t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he comes, he will convict the world of sin, righteousness, and judgment—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of sin, because they don’t believe in me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of righteousness, because I’m going to the Father and you will no longer see me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I still have a lot to say to you, but you cannot bear it now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet when the Spirit of Truth comes, he’ll guide you into all truth. He won’t speak on his own accord, but he’ll speak whatever he hears and will declare to you the things that are to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will glorify me, because he will take what is mine and declare it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that the Father has is mine. That is why I said, ‘He will take what is mine and declare it to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a little while you will no longer see me, then in a little while you will see me again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point, some of his disciples asked each other, “What does he mean by telling us, ‘In a little while you will no longer see me, then in a little while you will see me again,’ and, ‘because I am going to the Father’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept saying, “What is this ‘in a little while’ that he keeps talking about? We don’t know what he means.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew that they wanted to ask him a question, so he asked them, “Are you discussing among yourselves what I meant when I said, ‘In a little while you will no longer see me, then in a little while you will see me again’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, you’ll cry and mourn, but the world will rejoice. You’ll be deeply distressed, but your pain will turn into joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a woman is in labor she has pain, because her time has come. Yet when she has given birth to her child, she doesn’t remember the agony anymore because of the joy of having brought a human being into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are having pain. But I’ll see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, you won’t ask me for anything. Truly, I tell all of you emphatically, whatever you ask the Father for in my name, he will give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So far you haven’t asked for anything in my name. Keep asking and you will receive, so that your joy may be complete.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have said these things to you in figurative language. The time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figurative language, but will tell you plainly about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, you will make your requests in my name, so that I will have no need to ask the Father on your behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Father himself loves you, and because you have loved me and believed that I came from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I left the Father and came into the world. Now I’m leaving the world and going back to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus’ disciples said, “Well, now you’re speaking plainly and not using figurative language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that you know everything and don’t need to have anyone ask you any questions. Because of this, we believe that you have come from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, the time is coming, indeed it has already come, when you will be scattered, each of you to his own home, and you will leave me all by myself. Yet I’m not alone, because the Father is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you this so that through me you may have peace. In the world you’ll have trouble, but be courageous—I’ve overcome the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said this, he looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the hour has come. Glorify your Son, so that the Son may glorify you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have given him authority over all humanity so that he might give eternal life to all those you gave him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is eternal life: to know you, the only true God, and the one whom you sent—Jesus the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I glorified you on earth by completing the task you gave me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have made your name known to these men whom you gave me from the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me, and they have kept your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they realize that everything you gave me comes from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the words that you gave me I passed on to them. They have received them and know for sure that I came from you. They have believed that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am asking on their behalf. I am not asking on behalf of the world, but on behalf of those you gave me, because they are yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that is mine is yours, and what is yours is mine, and I have been glorified through them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by your Name, the Name that you gave me, so that they may be one, as we are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with them, I protected them by the authority that you gave me. I guarded them, and not one of them became lost except the one who was destined for destruction, so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now I am coming to you, and I say these things in the world so that they may have my joy made complete in themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them, because they do not belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m not asking you to take them out of the world but to protect them from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sanctify them by the truth. Your word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as you sent me into the world, so I have sent them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is for their sakes that I sanctify myself, so that they, too, may be sanctified by the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I ask not only on behalf of these men, but also on behalf of those who will believe in me through their message,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they may all be one. Just as you, Father, are in me and I am in you, may they also be one in us, so that the world may believe that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have given them the glory that you gave me, so that they may be one, just as we are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am in them, and you are in me. May they be completely one, so that the world may know that you sent me and that you have loved them as you loved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am and to see my glory, which you gave me because you loved me before the creation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Righteous Father, the world has never known you. Yet I have known you, and these men have known that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made your name known to them, and will continue to make it known, so that the love you have for me may be in them and I myself may be in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said all of this, he went with his disciples across the Kidron valley to a place where there was a garden, which he and his disciples entered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, because Jesus often met there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas took a detachment of soldiers and some officers from the high priests and the Pharisees and went there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, knowing everything that was going to happen, went forward and asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered him, “Jesus from Nazareth.”
Jesus told them, “I AM.” Judas, the man who betrayed him, was standing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus told them, “I AM,” they backed away and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he asked them again, “Who are you looking for?”
They said, “Jesus from Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I told you that I am the one, so if you are looking for me, let these men go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was to fulfill what he had said, “I did not lose a single one of those you gave me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, cutting off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told Peter, “Put your sword back into its sheath. Shouldn’t I drink the cup that the Father has given me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers, along with their commander and the Jewish officers, arrested Jesus and tied him up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First they brought him to Annas, because he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caiaphas was the person who had advised the Jews that it was better to have one man die for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. Since the other disciple was known to the high priest, he accompanied Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, however, stood outside the gate. So this other disciple who was known to the high priest went out and spoke to the gatekeeper and brought Peter inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young woman at the gate asked Peter, “You aren’t one of this man’s disciples, too, are you?”
“I am not,” he replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the servants and officers were standing around a charcoal fire they had built and were warming themselves because it was cold. Peter was also standing with them, keeping himself warm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his own teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “I have spoken publicly to the world. I have always taught in the synagogue or in the Temple, where all Jews meet together, and I have said nothing in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you question me? Question those who heard what I said. These are the people who know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he said this, one of the officers standing nearby slapped Jesus on the face and demanded, “Is that any way to answer the high priest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If I have said anything wrong, tell me what it was. But if I have told the truth, why do you hit me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas sent him, with his hands tied, to Caiaphas the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meanwhile, Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. Some people asked him, “You aren’t one of his disciples, too, are you?”
He denied it by saying, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the high priest’s servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “I saw you in the garden with Jesus, didn’t I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter again denied it, and immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led from Caiaphas to the governor’s headquarters early in the morning. The Jews did not go into the headquarters, to avoid becoming unclean and unable to eat the Passover meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate came out to them and asked, “What accusation are you bringing against this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “If he weren’t a criminal, we wouldn’t have handed him over to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate told them, “You take him and try him according to your Law.”
The Jewish leaders told him, “It is not legal for us to put anyone to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was to fulfill what Jesus had said when he indicated the kind of death he was to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate went back into the governor’s headquarters, summoned Jesus, and asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Are you asking this on your own initiative, or did others tell you about me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “I am not a Jew, am I? It is your own nation and high priests who have handed you over to me. What have you done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “My kingdom does not belong to this world. If my kingdom belonged to this world, my servants would fight to keep me from being handed over to the Jewish leaders. But for now my kingdom is not from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “So you are a king?”
Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king. I was born for this, and I came into the world for this: to testify to the truth. Everyone who is committed to the truth listens to my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate asked him, “What is ‘truth’?” and then he went out to the Jewish leaders again and told them, “I find no basis for a charge against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have a custom that I release one person for you at Passover. Do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this, they shouted out again, “Not this fellow, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate had Jesus taken away and whipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers twisted some thorns into a victor’s crown, put it on his head, and threw a purple robe on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept coming up to him and saying, “Long live the king of the Jews!” Then they began to slap him on the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate went outside again and told the Jews, “Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus came outside, wearing the victor’s crown of thorns and the purple robe.
Pilate told them, “Here is the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the high priests and the officials saw him, they shouted, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
Pilate told them, “You take him and crucify him. I find no basis for a charge against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders answered Pilate, “We have a law, and according to that Law he must die because he made himself out to be the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he became even more afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Returning to his headquarters, he asked Jesus, “Where are you from?”
But Jesus did not answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked him, “Aren’t you going to speak to me? You realize, don’t you, that I have the authority to release you and the authority to crucify you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “You have no authority over me at all, except what was given to you from above. That’s why the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on, Pilate tried to release him, but the Jewish leaders kept shouting, “If you release this fellow, you’re not a friend of Caesar! Anyone who claims to be a king is defying Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat in a place called The Pavement, which in Hebrew is called Gabbatha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the Preparation Day for the Passover, about noon. He told the Jewish leaders, “Here is your king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!”
Pilate asked them, “Should I crucify your king?”
The high priests responded, “We have no king but Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate handed him over to be crucified, and they took Jesus away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carrying the cross all by himself, he went out to what is called The Place of a Skull, which in Hebrew is called Golgotha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they crucified him, along with two others, one on each side of him with Jesus in the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wrote an inscription and put it on the cross. It read, “Jesus from Nazareth, the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many Jews read this inscription, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city. It was written in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish high priests told Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but that this fellow said, ‘I am the King of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “What I have written I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, one for each soldier, and took his cloak as well. The cloak was seamless, woven in one piece from the top down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they told each other, “Let’s not tear it. Instead, let’s throw dice to see who gets it.” This was to fulfill the Scripture that says,
“They divided my clothes among themselves,
    and for my clothing they threw dice.”
So that is what the soldiers did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, standing near Jesus’ cross were his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he kept loving standing there, he told his mother, “Dear lady, here is your son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the disciple, “Here is your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, when Jesus realized that everything was now completed, he said (in order to fulfill the Scripture), “I’m thirsty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A jar of sour wine was standing there, so they put a sponge full of the wine on a branch of hyssop and held it to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had taken the wine, he said, “It is finished.” Then he bowed his head and released his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since it was the Preparation Day, the Jewish leaders did not want to leave the bodies on the crosses during the Sabbath, because that was a particularly important Sabbath. So they asked Pilate to have the men’s legs broken and the bodies removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers went and broke the legs of the first man and then of the other man who had been crucified with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water immediately came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who saw this has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows he is telling the truth so that you, too, may believe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because these things happened so that the Scripture might be fulfilled:
“None of his bones will be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In addition, another passage of Scripture says,
“They will look on the one whom they pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus (though a secret one because he was afraid of the Jewish leaders), asked Pilate to let him remove the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, and he came and removed his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, the man who had first come to Jesus at night, also arrived, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about 100 litra.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in linen cloths along with spices, according to the burial custom of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A garden was located in the place where he was crucified, and in that garden was a new tomb in which no one had yet been placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it was the Jewish Preparation Day, and because the tomb was nearby, they put Jesus there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the week, early in the morning and while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and noticed that the stone had been removed from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she ran off and went to Simon Peter and the other disciple, whom Jesus kept loving. She told them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter and the other disciple took off for the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two of them were running together, but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and came to the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bending over to look inside, he noticed the linen cloths lying there, but didn’t go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point Simon Peter arrived, following him, and went straight into the tomb. He observed that the linen cloths were lying there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that the handkerchief that had been on Jesus’ head was not lying with the linen cloths but was rolled up in a separate place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other disciple, who arrived at the tomb first, went inside, looked, and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they did not yet understand the Scripture that said that Jesus had to rise from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went back to their homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Mary stood crying outside the tomb. As she cried, she bent over and looked into the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw two angels in white clothes who were sitting down, one at the head and the other at the foot of the place where Jesus’ body had been lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked her, “Lady, why are you crying?”
She told them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don’t know where they have put him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After she had said this, she turned around and noticed Jesus standing there, without realizing that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked her, “Dear lady, why are you crying? Who are you looking for?”
Thinking he was the gardener, she told him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus told her, “Mary!”
She turned around and told him in Hebrew, “Rabbouni!” (which means “Teacher”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “Don’t hold on to me, because I haven’t yet ascended to the Father. But go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I’m ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I’ve seen the Lord!” She also told them what he had told her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the evening of the first day of the week, and the doors of the house where the disciples had met were locked because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus came and stood among them. He told them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, he showed them his hands and his side, and when they saw the Lord, the disciples were overjoyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them again, “Peace be with you. Just as the Father has sent me, so I am sending you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he breathed on them and told them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forgive people’s sins, they are forgiven. If you retain people’s sins, they are retained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas, one of the Twelve (called the Twin), wasn’t with them when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the other disciples kept telling him, “We’ve seen the Lord!” But he told them, “Unless I see the nail marks in his hands, put my finger into them, and put my hand into his side, I’ll never believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A week later, his disciples were again inside, and Thomas was with them. Even though the doors were shut, Jesus came, stood among them, and said, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Take your hand, and put it into my side. Stop doubting, but believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Is it because you’ve seen me that you have believed? How blessed are those who have never seen me and yet have believed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples that are not recorded in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these have been recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and so that through believing you may have life in his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. This is what happened:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter, Thomas (called the Twin), Nathaniel from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two of his other disciples were together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter told them, “I’m going fishing.”
They all told him, “We’ll go with you, too.” So they went out and got into the boat but didn’t catch a thing that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as dawn was breaking, Jesus stood on the shore. The disciples didn’t realize it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked them, “Children, you don’t have any fish, do you?”
They answered him, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Throw the net on the right hand side of the boat, and you’ll catch some.” So they threw it out and were unable to haul it in because it was so full of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That disciple whom Jesus kept loving told Peter, “It’s the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put his clothes back on, because he was practically naked, and jumped into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other disciples came in the boat, dragging the net full of fish. They were only about 200 cubits away from the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived at the shore, they saw a charcoal fire with fish lying on it, and some bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Bring me some of the fish you’ve just caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter went aboard and dragged the net ashore. It was full of large fish—153 of them. And although there were so many of them, the net was not torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “Come, have breakfast.” Now none of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?”, because they knew it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the bread, gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was now the third time that Jesus revealed himself to the disciples after he had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they had finished breakfast, Jesus asked Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these?”
Peter told him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.”
Jesus told him, “Feed my lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he asked him a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?”
Peter told him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.”
Jesus told him, “Take care of my sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked him a third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?”
Peter was deeply hurt that he had asked him a third time, “Do you love me?” So he told him, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you!”
Jesus told him, “Feed my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, I tell you emphatically, when you were young, you would fasten your belt and go wherever you liked. But when you get old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will fasten your belt and take you where you don’t want to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now he said this to show by what kind of death he would glorify God.
After saying this, Jesus told him, “Keep following me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned around and noticed the disciple whom Jesus kept loving following them. He was the one who had put his head on Jesus’ chest at the supper and had asked, “Lord, who is the one who is going to betray you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw him, he said, “Lord, what about him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “If it’s my will for him to remain until I come back, how does that concern you? You must keep following me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the rumor spread among the brothers that this disciple wasn’t going to die. Yet Jesus didn’t say to Peter that he wasn’t going to die, but, “If it’s my will for him to remain until I come back, how does that concern you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the disciple who is testifying to these things and has written them down. We know that his testimony is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of course, Jesus also did many other things, and I suppose that if every one of them were written down, the world couldn’t contain the books that would be written.
verses.speaker: Narrator
